arm_group.description: >80% of feeds consisting of breast milk at both scanning points
>80% of feeds consisting of formula milk at both scanning points
20%-80% of feeds consisting of breast milk.

brief_summary.textblock:
Breast feeding is believed to be beneficial to long-term health but how these effects are
      mediated is unknown. I suggest that this may be through effects on body composition and
      metabolism.

      I will compare adipose tissue and liver fat deposition in  healthy, full term breast and
      formula fed infants babies shortly after birth and around 12 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy baby

          -  Term baby

          -  Appropriate weight for gestational age (UK - WHO 2009 growth charts)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Infants of diabetic mothers

          -  Infants of smokers

          -  Infants fed non-commercial or non-cows milk based infant formulae

study_pop.textblock:
Healthy, full term, appropriate weight for gestational age infants recruited on the
        postnatal ward at Chelsea and Westminster Hospital, London, UK.

facility.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

primary_outcome.description: Change in total adipose tissue volume, measured using whole body magnetic resonance imaging, between the neonatal period and 6-12 weeks age.
primary_outcome.measure: Change in total adipose tissue volume of breast fed infants compared to formula fed infants.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Change in regional adipose tissue distribution, measured using whole body magnetic resonance imaging, between the neonatal period and 6-12 weeks age.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in regional adipose tissue distribution of breastfed compared to formula fed infants.

secondary_outcome.description: Change in intrahepatocellular lipid, measured using in-vivo hepatic magnetic resonance spectroscopy, between the neonatal period and 6-12 weeks age.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in intrahepatocellular lipid of breast fed infants compared to formula fed infants.

collaborator.agency: Chelsea and Westminster NHS Foundation Trust

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
